0.Summary: "My experience as a worker in the fast food."
0.Cons: Overworked.Horrible hours.Management will sweat you over the littlest things.

1.Pros: I needed a job and they were hiring.

2.Cons: Bad management bad pay crappy job

3.Pros: - Good place to learn work ethic for young employees- Management is always supportive and helpful- Good training system so employees are aware of the duties of their job
3.Cons: - While the job is good for part-time workers, there was a high number of fulltime employees being paid a low minimum wage- The amount of menu items is ridiculous and employees often get overwhelmed- Shifts could get long and erratic. some would go 9 or 10 hours and I could find myself working at random times in the day.

4.Cons: there are no cons of working at mcdonalds

5.Pros: you meet all sorts of people you get to deal with a diffeerent problem everyday
5.Cons: there is not adownside at mcdonalds

6.Pros: Easy to get hired. I literally showed up to the interview after preparing extensively for everything. I was hired almost before I could utter a word.
6.Cons: You will get screamed at, cussed out, and spoken to like trash on the sidewalk over pennies, free water cups or cookies not being hot. And managers encourage employees to basically dehumanize themselves and be a punching bag for customers who have as much respect for you as they do for a dead bug. You can be a mother of three or a veteran and you could get spoken to in ways you never imagined. Be careful. This job is for incredibly thick-skinned people.

7.Cons: Bad hoursHalf shiftsBetter choice of co workers

8.Pros: Very busy time goes by quickly!
8.Cons: Disrespectful young employees that think they know it all. Young managers that treat older managers with disrespect. Lack of cleanliness!

9.Pros: Great benefits, good hours, fair compensation. Perks of the food, and the opportunities to move ahead in the corporate ladder.
9.Cons: Busy, customers can be rude sometimes. Overnight shifts can be tiring as well.
